This experimental opioid court is an iteration of the traditional drug court, where an addicted, usually nonviolent offender is channeled into recovery as an alternative to jail and a chance at a reduced sentence.
But it can often take weeks or longer to get a defendant into a detox or inpatient treatment center.

But here, if the defendant wants to get clean, Judge Hannah immediately hits pause on the criminal charges to get the person into treatment as fast as possible.
Right from arraignment, we put the clock on hold.
We turn off the court reporter.
